Note: Participant believes that screen is much clearer outdoors than indoors and says less light sources could contribute to this effect. It is gloomy and cloudy
Participant says neural band is responsive to hand gestures and has not noted issues
Participant notices that images being captured don’t accurately reflect intended subjects and says they must remember where the camera is located on the glasses to capture intended images
Given cold outdoor temperature, participant ‘s fingers feel stiffer and says this stiffness affects their ability to perform hand gestures in suitable manner
Participant says deeper orange colors appear red in MR display when building legos
Participant has trouble viewing contents on screen when background is cluttered and says looking at the solid colored wall is helpful when viewing display

Participant says small details are not obviously identifiable through images but they can deduce underlying information about Legos by examining pieces available. For example, it’s not clear that the instructions call for 2 of the same Lego piece based on the image, but user does not see a larger piece and concludes that 2 are used
Participant appears to be squinting slightly to view Lego images
Participant focuses eye contact on solid backgrounds
Weather is gloomy (no sun shining but not extremely dark)
